content: garter stitch gives these mitts lots of stretch for a good a fit worked sideways with the thumb at the center the cast on edge and bound off edge are seamed along the side of the hand short row are used to shape the thumb and give the cuff a snug fit knit in a double strand of heather 2/8 this pattern will work for any worsted weight **size ** adult medium **yarn ** jagger spun heather 2/8 fingering 100 g = 498 yards 1 hank each in 2 colors will make 3 pair of mitts shown in moss and teal **gauge ** 20 sts and 40 row = 4 in garter stitch with 2 strands held together **check your gauge to ensure a proper fit ** **suggested needle ** us 5 3 75 mm ** use whatever size needle you need to obtain gauge **
